Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text dealing with sale of land: on recto 4 ll. of demotic and 11 ll. of Greek docket, on verso names of 16 witnesses and 1 l. of demotic with indicaton of the document's nature. Dated year 12 Tybi of Ptolemy Philopator. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale and receipt of land by Nicon called Petechons son of Athenion to Thoteus son of Psenmin. scribe. Chesthotes son of Hor". Its corresponding bill of cession is P BM EA 10464. Cut in 3 sections and mounted in 3 frames.
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Thompson's MS Catalogue includes the identification number: "1887-4-2, 1428".
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.69-70, pl.54, 57)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (8518) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/8518)
